definitions.Accounting Principles: Generally accepted accounting principles in England, including IFRS
definitions.Affiliate: A Subsidiary of the person or a Holding Company of that person or any other Subsidiary of that Holding Company
definitions.Authorisation: An authorisation, consent, approval, resolution, licence, exemption, filing, notarisation or registration
definitions.Available Commitment: Lender's Commitment minus the Base Currency Amount of any outstanding Loans and any Loans due to be made on or before the proposed Utilisation Date
definitions.Business Day: A day (other than a Saturday or Sunday) on which banks are open for general business in London
definitions.Change of Control: An event where any person or persons acting in concert, other than a holding company with substantially similar shareholders as the pre-existing shareholders of the Borrower, becomes interested in more than 50% of the issued ordinary share capital or voting rights of the Borrower
definitions.Commitment: £50,000,000 to the extent not cancelled, reduced or transferred
definitions.Confidential Information: All information relating to the Company, the Group, this Agreement or the Facility of which the Lender becomes aware in its capacity as, or for the purpose of becoming, the Lender
definitions.Default: An Event of Default or any event or circumstance that would become an Event of Default after the expiry of a grace period, the giving of notice, or the making of any determination under this Agreement
definitions.Disruption Event: A material disruption to payment or communications systems or financial markets required for the Facility, or a technical or systems-related disruption to the treasury or payments operations of a Party preventing them from performing payment obligations or communicating in accordance with the Agreement terms
definitions.Event of Default: Any event or circumstance specified as such in Clause 14
definitions.Facility Office: The office or offices notified by the Lender to the Borrower through which it will perform its obligations under this Agreement
definitions.Finance Lease: Any lease or hire purchase contract which would be treated as a balance sheet liability according to the Accounting Principles
definitions.Financial Indebtedness: Indebtedness in respect of moneys borrowed, debit balances, acceptance credits, note purchase facilities, bonds, debentures, loan stock, Finance Leases, receivables sold or discounted, and Treasury Transactions

human_readable_highlights.key_economics: The loan amount is £50,000,000 with a term of 12 months, available as a term loan facility.
human_readable_highlights.risks: Potential risks include events of default such as a change of control or disruption events that affect financial or payment systems.
human_readable_highlights.unusual_features: The definition of 'Change of Control' includes specific provisions regarding the composition of shareholders post-event, which is particularly tailored to the borrower's corporate structure.
